reviews.review: This game is awesome, the story and the gameplay make the game very immersive.
Игра которая должна быть в коллекции у каждого ценителя интерактивного исскуства

Half-Life 2 é um jogo que consegue aliar uma história misteriosa e muito interessante com um gameplay rápido e famoso por ter dado origem a um dos fps mais populares de todas os tempos, Counter Strike. O único problema é que o jogo se extende muito no final, gerando níveis muito grandes e, às vezes, enjoativos. Os gráficos, para a época, eram muito bonitos e até hoje conseguem chamar atenção. Os cenários são muito variados, assim como os inimigos, que vão de soldados do governo à alienígenas. O final deixa uma belíssima ponta para continuação, que seria o tão aguardado e improvável Half-Life 3.

This is a game where you can be stealthy, without trying to be stealthy; where it can be scary, without trying to be scary; creepy without trying to be creepy; hectic, without trying to be hectic.
Key is subtlety !! The small things go on to create the grim backdrop of City 17, and it does a good job with immersing the player. This helps build empathy for the main protagonist, Gordon Freeman, which is why it can play with the senses in ways mentioned above.
I've personally played this game numerous times over the years; more recently, I've been playing about with spawn commands, just to see how the various 'actors' react to each other.
A good game, and one you'll find yourself returning to every so often :D

What even is Half-Life

score: 8/10
SteamデビューはSkyrimなのでゲーム歴の浅いにわかですがこのゲームをプレイしていると既視感を感じる事が多いのです。
それは恐らく自分が今までプレイして来たゲームがこのゲームに多大な影響を受けているからなのだと思います。Half-LifeはFPSにストーリー性を持たせた先駆的なゲームとして高く評価されましたが、HL2ではそれだけに留まらず高度なグラフィック、物理エンジン、常にゲームの新しい可能性を追求し他の一歩先を行こうとする姿勢を強く感じます。2004年のゲームですが2013年現在にプレイしても全く古さを感じさせない理由はそういう所にあるのでしょう。
クリアし終わった感想としては、2004年当時の価値観で評価すれば勿論傑作には違いありませんが、現在の価値観で評価すれば荒削りな部分も多いし、チャプター毎の面白さにバラつきがあり、乗り物チャプターが総じて評判が悪いのも納得できます。
しかし盛り上がるチャプターではそれらを相殺できるほど楽しめたのも確かなわけで、やはり洋ゲーファンであれば一度はプレイしてもらいたい名作ですね！

Hands down one of my favourite PC Games of all time. Was revolutionary for its time for Graphics, Real-time Physics, and gameplay mechanics. I built a gaming computer just to play this game and didn't regret my investment. It gave me hope of what was to come for gaming.

Sadly, not many games since then have come close to the excellence that is HL2. It is the perfect blend of action, diverse locations, unique gameplay segments, and story telling. The characters feel human and express scarily realistic emotion. The facial recognition technology or animation team did a wonderful job at bringing the characters in the half-life 2 universe to life.

It's easy to see why this game is featured in so many top 10 PC game lists but it's even easier to experience what makes this game so awesome for yourself. You will never play a game that feels or looks anything like Half Life 2, it is that special.

All hail the crowbar!

This is the game that got me hooked on shooters. In that respect I guess it has a lot to answer for! And, along with Episodes 1 and 2, it remains my favourite to this day. Valve have taken their 1998 classic Half-Life and improved on it in every conceivable way. Much improved graphics, much improved physics, much improved AI, and much improved weapons, most notably the wondrous gravity gun. Once again it mixes a wide variety of spectacular environments with some satisfying puzzles and some fantastic combat. It also develops the story started in the original and fleshes it out nicely. Another important gain is the introduction of Alyx and her father Ely. Alyx will be a welcome companion and will, periodically, fight by your side. This is a big factor in HL2 -- the introduction of team play. You will have small bands of resistance fighters with you sporadically during play in the single player mode and this adds a team element which greatly increases immersion and the sense that what you do matters. I could bang on about this game for ever and a day, but just let me say this: play it -- you won’t regret it.

5/5

half life 2 it's wonderful

Half-Life 2 is probably the best example of physics working well for a game.  They make it part of the story and they make it good.  Propelling a can of paint at a Combine soldier won't necessarily kill him, but damnit, it's fun to do.  The only thing I don't like about HL2 is the lack of accurate weapons with the exception of the crossbow.  The enemies often shoot you from quite a distance and there's usually nothing you can do to kill them without wasting plenty of ammo.  But overall, HL2 is still one of my favorite games.  And it holds up.
The Grand Theft Auto V or Shadow of the Colossus of PC games.
